intro: Hyptis persica, commonly known as the Persian hyptis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically violet or purple, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the branches. Hyptis persica is often grown for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
